metadata.feature_description: Manage article metadata, custom fields, and article type categorization

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View Article Types in Create Dialog

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module and click Create article
steps.expected: Create article dialog should open with Article Type dropdown
steps.actual: Create article dialog opened with Article Type dropdown containing 12 article types: Teams/Groups, Animals, Misc., Architecture, Geography, Procedures, Concepts, Media, Books, Awards, Events, People

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Article Type Disabled for Existing Articles

steps.action: Navigate to existing article 'Test Person Article for Metadata' and click Edit
steps.expected: Edit dialog should show Article Type as disabled/read-only
steps.actual: Edit dialog shows Article Type dropdown as disabled with 'People' selected - Article Type cannot be changed after article creation

steps.action: Click 'Edit...' link in the Overview section sidebar
steps.expected: Metadata editor dialog should open with Image and Metadata tabs
steps.actual: Edit Meta Data dialog opened with Image tab (for article image upload) and Metadata tab

steps.expected: Custom metadata fields for the article type should be displayed
steps.actual: Metadata tab shows custom fields specific to 'People' article type: Name, Spouse, Lineage, Father, Mother, Born, Died, Burial, Aliases, Weight, Height, Known For, Nationality, Occupation

steps.action: Fill in metadata fields: Name='Test Person Name', Nationality='Test Country', Occupation='Software Tester'
steps.expected: Values should be entered in the fields
steps.actual: All three metadata values were successfully entered into the respective fields

steps.expected: Metadata should be saved and displayed in Overview section
steps.actual: Metadata was saved successfully. Overview section now displays: Name: Test Person Name, Nationality: Test Country, Occupation: Software Tester

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Metadata Display in Article View

steps.action: View article page to see metadata in sidebar
steps.expected: Saved metadata should appear in Overview section on article detail page
steps.actual: Overview section in sidebar displays saved metadata in table format with field names and values

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Form Validation for New Article

steps.action: Fill article form with Title, Article Type, Tags but leave Content empty and click Publish
steps.expected: Validation error should appear indicating required fields
steps.actual: Validation error 'Text is required' appeared for the Content field, preventing form submission

observations: Article Types are predefined and associated with different custom metadata field sets (e.g., 'People' type has Name, Spouse, Lineage, etc.)
Article Type can only be set during article creation - it becomes read-only after the article is created
Metadata editor (Image and Metadata tabs) is accessible via the 'Edit...' link in the Overview section of the article sidebar
Custom metadata fields vary based on the Article Type selected - the 'People' type has person-specific fields while other types would have different fields
Tags function as an additional form of metadata that can be freely added/removed from articles
The MetaDataEditor.ascx control renders metadata fields dynamically based on Article Type using Knockout.js bindings
Field types supported include text inputs (FieldType=1), dates (FieldType=0), URLs (FieldType=2), booleans (FieldType=3), and multiline text (FieldType=4) as seen in the code
